item.title: Rita add a quote by Alice Sebold
item.description: "You save yourself or you remain unsaved." -- Alice Sebold

item.title: Rita add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "The struggle of man against power is the struggle of memory against forgetting" -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Rita add a quote by Thomas Harris
item.description: "Over this odd world, this half the world that's dark now, I have to hunt a thing that lives on tears." -- Thomas Harris

item.title: Rita add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "This was not a fearie tale. This was not the movies. This was life. It hurt more. It was excruciating. It was excruciatingly beautiful." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Rita add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "All the things that girls feel they are not when they fear that if they become, if they are, they will no longer be loved by the sisters whose hearts they have not meant to break. And besides, if the sisters are gone and only the beloved remains with his dense curls and his lips, how safe are you then? You have to have him or you will die if the sisters are gone with their listening ears and their feet to rub and their bodies to dress and their shared loneliness." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Rita add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Maturity is a bitter disappointment for which no remedy exists, unless laughter could be said to remedy anything." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Rita add a quote by Thomas Harris
item.description: "There is a common emotion we all recognize and have not yet named -- the happy anticipation of being able to feel contempt." -- Thomas Harris

item.title: Rita add a quote by Marya Hornbacher
item.description: "That’s the nice thing about dreams, the way you wake up before you fall." -- Marya Hornbacher

item.title: Rita add a quote by Marya Hornbacher
item.description: "This is the very boring part of eating disorders, the aftermath. When you eat and hate that you eat. And yet of course you must eat. You don’t really entertain the notion of going back. You, with some startling new level of clarity, realize that going back would be far worse than simply being as you are. This is obvious to anyone without an eating disorder. This is not always obvious to you." -- Marya Hornbacher

item.title: Rita add a quote by Marya Hornbacher
item.description: "I was perpetually grief-stricken when I finished a book, and would slide down from my sitting position on the bed, put my cheek on the pillow and sigh for a long time. It seemed there would never be another book. It was all over, the book was dead. It lay in its bent cover by my hand. What was the use? Why bother dragging the weight of my small body down to dinner? Why move? Why breathe? The book had left me, and there was no reason to go on." -- Marya Hornbacher

item.title: Rita add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Rita add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Rita add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "Think of your head as an unsafe neighborhood; don't go there alone." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Rita add a quote by Mark Z. Danielewski
Rita add a quote by Margery Williams Bianco
item.description: "Generally, by the time you are Real, most of your hair has been loved off, and your eyes drop out and you get loose in the joints and very shabby. But these things don't matter at all, because once you are Real you can't be ugly, except to people who don't understand." -- Margery Williams Bianco

item.title: Rita add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Rita add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The idea that I can't share my problems with other people makes me not give a shit about their problems." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Rita add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "If I can't be beautiful, I want to be invisible." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Rita add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "And if you can find any way out of our culture, then that's a trap too. Just wanting to get out of the trap reinforces the trap." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Rita add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "I want out of the labels. I don't want my whole life crammed into a single word. A story. I want to find something else, unknowable, some place to be that's not on the map. A real adventure.' A spinx. A mystery. A blank. Unknown. Undefined." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Rita add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Your birth is a mistake you'll spend your whole life trying to correct." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Rita add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Tell the world what scares you most. Save the world with some advice from the future." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Rita add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "I'm not straight, and I'm not gay. I'm not bisexual. I want out of the labels. I don't want my whole life crammed into a single word. A story. I want to find something else, unknowable, some place to be that's not on the map. A real adventure." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Rita add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Tengo had a gift for such work. He was a born technician, possessing both the intense concentration of a bird sailing through the air in search of prey and the patience of a donkey hauling water, playing always by the rules of the game." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Rita add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "I'm not afraid to die. What I'm afraid of is having reality get the better of me, of having reality leave me behind." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Rita add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Reality was utterly coolheaded and utterly lonely." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Rita add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "At some point the future becomes reality. And then it quickly becomes the past." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Rita add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Life is so uncertain: you never know what could happen. One way to deal with that is to keep your pajamas washed." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Rita add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "After such prolonged frowning, it took her some moments to recall what her normal face even looked like, but after several attempts she was able to settle on a reasonable facsimile." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Rita add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "In the course of this one day, several things have taken a decisive step forward. The gears have turned forward with a click. And gears that have turned forward never turn back. That is one of the world's rules." -- Haruki Murakami
